ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.5.yaml:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
cxx_compiler:
- gxx
cxx_compiler_version:
- '14'
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
fortran_compiler:
- gfortran
fortran_compiler_version:
- '14'
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.5'
target_platform:
- linux-64
zip_keys:
- - c_compiler_version
  - cxx_compiler_version
  - fortran_compiler_version

about.summary: Facilitates treatment of statistical model specifications as things that can be generated and manipulated programmatically. Structural equation models may be specified with reticular action model matrices or paths, linear structural relations matrices or paths, or directly in matrix algebra. Fit functions include full information maximum likelihood, maximum likelihood, and weighted least squares. Example models include confirmatory factor, multiple group, mixture distribution, categorical threshold, modern test theory, differential equations, state space, and many others.  MacOS users can download the most up-to-date  package binaries from <http://openmx.ssri.psu.edu>. See Neale, Hunter, Pritikin, Zahery, Brick, Kirkpatrick, Estabrook, Bates, Maes, & Boker (2016) <doi:10.1007/s11336-014-9435-8>.

MacOS users can download the most up-to-date  package binaries from <http://openmx.ssri.psu.edu>. See Neale, Hunter, Pritikin, Zahery, Brick, Kirkpatrick, Estabrook, Bates, Maes, & Boker (2016) <doi:10.1007/s11336-014-9435-8>.

name: r-openmx

about.summary: Facilitates treatment of statistical model specifications as things that can be generated and manipulated programmatically. Structural equation models may be specified with reticular action model matrices or paths, linear structural relations matrices or paths, or directly in matrix algebra. Fit functions include full information maximum likelihood, maximum likelihood, and weighted least squares. Example models include confirmatory factor, multiple group, mixture distribution, categorical threshold, modern test theory, differential equations, state space, and many others.  MacOS users can download the most up-to-date  package binaries from <http://openmx.ssri.psu.edu>. See Neale, Hunter, Pritikin, Zahery, Brick, Kirkpatrick, Estabrook, Bates, Maes, & Boker (2016) <doi:10.1007/s11336-014-9435-8>.

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "2.22.10" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-openmx
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/OpenMx_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/OpenMx/OpenMx_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 09602133cd824f880018c0d70106075464c7d0ada9388d5bf8aaf71c81fc4dc4

build:
  number: 0
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/
  missing_dso_whitelist:
    - '*/R.dll'        # [win]
    - '*/Rblas.dll'    # [win]
    - '*/Rlapack.dll'  # [win]
  skip: true  # [r_base == "4.4"]

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('c') }}        # [not win]
    - {{ stdlib("c") }}          # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('cxx') }}      # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('fortran') }}  # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_c') }}  # [win]
    - {{ stdlib("m2w64_c") }}    # [win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_cxx') }}  # [win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_fortran') }}  # [win]
    - {{ posix }}filesystem        # [win]
    - {{ posix }}sed               # [win]
    - {{ posix }}grep              # [win]
    - {{ posix }}autoconf
    - {{ posix }}automake          # [not win]
    - {{ posix }}automake-wrapper  # [win]
    - pkg-config
    - {{ posix }}make
    - {{ posix }}coreutils         # [win]
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-bh >=1.69.0_1
    - r-mass
    - r-matrix >=1.2_16
    - r-rcpp
    - r-rcppeigen >=0.3.3.9.4
    - r-rcppparallel
    - r-stanheaders >=2.10.0.2
    - r-digest
    - r-lifecycle
    - r-rpf >=0.45
  run:
    - r-base
    #- r-bh >=1.69.0_1
    - r-mass
    - r-matrix >=1.2_16
    - r-rcpp
    - r-rcppeigen >=0.3.3.9.4
    - r-rcppparallel
    #- r-stanheaders >=2.10.0.2
    - r-digest
    - r-lifecycle
    - r-rpf >=0.45

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('OpenMx')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('OpenMx')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: http://openmx.ssri.psu.edu, https://github.com/OpenMx/OpenMx
  license: Apache-2.0
  summary: Facilitates treatment of statistical model specifications as things that can be generated and manipulated programmatically. Structural equation models may be specified with reticular action model matrices or paths, linear structural relations matrices or paths, or directly in matrix algebra. Fit functions include
    full information maximum likelihood, maximum likelihood, and weighted least squares. Example models include confirmatory factor, multiple group, mixture distribution, categorical threshold, modern test theory, differential equations, state space, and many others.  MacOS users can download the most up-to-date  package
    binaries from <http://openmx.ssri.psu.edu>. See Neale, Hunter, Pritikin, Zahery, Brick, Kirkpatrick, Estabrook, Bates, Maes, & Boker (2016) <doi:10.1007/s11336-014-9435-8>.
  license_family: APACHE
  license_file:
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - khusmann

Structural equation models may be specified with reticular action model matrices or paths, linear structural relations matrices or paths, or directly in matrix algebra. Fit functions include full information maximum likelihood, maximum likelihood, and weighted least squares. Example models include confirmatory factor, multiple group, mixture distribution, categorical threshold, modern test theory, differential equations, state space, and many others.
